common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties installing and launching Pieces OS on Windows and MacOS. Problems include installation failures, application crashes, and incompatibility with M1 Macs. Solutions involve providing detailed logs, reinstalling the application, and ensuring compatibility between the OS version and hardware architecture.

related_issues.title: Models Download Fail
related_issues.text:
Models Download Fail
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not able to download any of the models for ollama.
[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Surya reported an issue with Ollama failing to install in Pieces OS.
* Surya initially confirmed the fix in version 11.1.0, but later reported the issue resurfacing.
* Surya provided a log file for further analysis.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation failure in Pieces OS.
* Recurrence of the issue after initial fix.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 (initial fix).
* Request for additional support logs from Surya.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue remains open, pending further investigation with additional logs.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be specific to Surya's installation.
* The provided log file may offer valuable clues for troubleshooting.
* Mark, a Pieces team member, is actively engaged in resolving the issue.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User `GetReal444` reported an issue with booting up the Pieces application.
* Pieces support bot responded with helpful links and related issues.
* Support engineer `mark-at-pieces` requested additional information and offered a call to resolve the issue.
* The issue might be related to a previously resolved issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/620).

**Problems Identified:**

* User is unable to boot up the Pieces application.
* The cause of the issue is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support engineer requested diagnostic information from the user.
* Support engineer offered a call to troubleshoot the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still open and under investigation.
* The user has not yet responded to the support engineer's request for information.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* PASimmons encountered an issue where Pieces OS would not run on their M1 Mac.

**Problems identified:**

* Incompatible build: The user was using an Intel build of PiecesOS on an Apple Silicon M1 Mac.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Mark-at-pieces:**
    * Suggested uninstalling and reinstalling the correct version for Apple silicon from pieces.app.
* **PASimmons:**
    * Followed the instructions and reinstalled Pieces for Developers using the Apple Silicon download link.

**Current status/outcome:**

* **Resolved:** PASimmons confirmed that Pieces for developers ran successfully after using the correct version for their M1 Mac. 
* **Announcement:** Mark-at-pieces mentioned an ongoing announcement regarding similar issues in a different ticket (#615).

**Additional information:**

* The initial response from the bot provides helpful resources for users experiencing similar issues.
* The issue was identified and resolved quickly thanks to the prompt response and accurate troubleshooting steps provided by Mark-at-pieces. 

**Summary:**

This conversation demonstrates effective troubleshooting and resolution for an issue with running PiecesOS on an M1 Mac. The issue was quickly identified as an incompatible build, and the user was guided to install the correct version for their hardware, resulting in a successful outcome.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot Failure on Apple M1 Macs
common_issues.description: Users with Apple M1 Macs experience PiecesOS boot failures after updating to version 11.1.0 or later. The issue stems from accidentally installing the Intel build instead of the Apple Silicon version. The solution is to uninstall the existing PiecesOS and reinstall it using the correct build for Apple Silicon from the official website.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* PASimmons encountered an issue where Pieces OS would not run on their M1 Mac.

**Problems identified:**

* Incompatible build: The user was using an Intel build of PiecesOS on an Apple Silicon M1 Mac.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Mark-at-pieces:**
    * Suggested uninstalling and reinstalling the correct version for Apple silicon from pieces.app.
* **PASimmons:**
    * Followed the instructions and reinstalled Pieces for Developers using the Apple Silicon download link.

**Current status/outcome:**

* **Resolved:** PASimmons confirmed that Pieces for developers ran successfully after using the correct version for their M1 Mac. 
* **Announcement:** Mark-at-pieces mentioned an ongoing announcement regarding similar issues in a different ticket (#615).

**Additional information:**

* The initial response from the bot provides helpful resources for users experiencing similar issues.
* The issue was identified and resolved quickly thanks to the prompt response and accurate troubleshooting steps provided by Mark-at-pieces. 

**Summary:**

This conversation demonstrates effective troubleshooting and resolution for an issue with running PiecesOS on an M1 Mac. The issue was quickly identified as an incompatible build, and the user was guided to install the correct version for their hardware, resulting in a successful outcome.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS/App Failing to Launch or Freezing
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS or app failing to launch, freezing, or becoming unresponsive on Ubuntu, Windows, and Linux Mint. Issues potentially related to CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension, Flutter TextFields, or unknown causes. Proposed solutions include reinstalling, disabling on-screen keyboard, and awaiting hotfixes. Pieces team actively investigating and providing support.

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**- Key Points:**

* User (@Rohit0072) reported an issue with booting up the Pieces app.
* The bot directed the user to similar issues and resources.
* A Pieces team member (@mark-at-pieces) reached out to the user for further assistance.

**- Problem:**

* The Pieces app on the user's device is unable to boot properly.

**- Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* The bot suggested similar issues and resources.
* @mark-at-pieces provided contact information for a follow-up.

**- Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is in communication with @mark-at-pieces to resolve the issue.

**- Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place on February 9th and 10th, 2025.
* The specific details of the problem remain unclear.

I hope this concise summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any other questions.

related_issues.title: Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @94tejas reported the Pieces app freezing issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and assigned to the appropriate team member.
* The issue is related to Flutter TextFields causing app freezes on specific versions of Linux Mint.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app freezes on specific versions of Linux Mint.
* This issue is related to a known Flutter bug.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Disable on-screen keyboard as a workaround.
* Awaiting a hotfix from Flutter to address the TextFields issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being tracked by the Pieces team.
* A fix is expected in the near future. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The Pieces support bot provided helpful resources and related issues for reference.
* The Pieces team member acknowledged the issue and apologized for the inconvenience.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Launch and Access Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching Pieces OS and the desktop app, encountering errors related to localhost access, port numbers, and service initiation failures. Troubleshooting steps include verifying port configurations, reinstalling the application, and checking system compatibility. Support engineers are actively engaged in resolving these issues, offering guidance and live troubleshooting sessions.

related_issues.title: i got this error when opening localhost
related_issues.text:
i got this error when opening localhost
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9a5eb05e-1c2f-4e2f-aa3a-205d8791de81)
so
when I was opening the localhost for testing I got this problem
i already search for a solution but i cant fix that
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Difficulty accessing Pieces on port 1000 and 3000.

**Key Points:**

* User reported the issue and received an automated response from the Pieces support bot.
* The bot provided helpful resources and informed the user about the issue routing.
* Mark-at-pieces clarified that Pieces is hosted on 39300 and not on 1000 and 3000.

**Problems:**

* User could not access Pieces on the mentioned ports.

**Solutions:**

* Mark-at-pieces clarified the correct port number (39300).

**Current Status:**

* The issue seems to be resolved with the clarification of the correct port number.
* The user did not provide further response after the solution was offered.

**Outcome:**

* The user should be able to access Pieces on port 39300. 
* If the issue persists, the user can reach out to Pieces support for further assistance.

related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type PiecesWebSocketCreator is not registered inside GetIt. 
(Did you accidentally do GetIt sl=GetIt.instance(); instead of GetIt sl=GetIt.instance;
Did you forget to register it?)

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: false
Path: 

**PiecesOS Information**

User: Anonymous
Current Version: Unknown
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39301

**Device Information**

Operating System: Linux
Current Version: Linux 6.8.0-50-generic #51-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sat Nov  9 17:58:29 UTC 2024
Min Version Supported: Ubuntu 18
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Nagarajan2004 is unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service.

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue has been ongoing for several days.
* The user has already reviewed related issues and documentation but hasn't found a solution.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The support bot suggested checking existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.
* The Pieces support representative, mack-at-pieces, suggested scheduling a live troubleshooting session.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not responded to mack-at-pieces' suggestion for a live troubleshooting session.
* The issue remains unresolved.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Linux Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with PiecesOS on Linux, including Copilot Live Context not working, app freezes, and inability to open the Copilot service. Proposed solutions include updating to the latest PiecesOS version, disabling the on-screen keyboard, and waiting for a Flutter hotfix. Some issues remain unresolved and require further investigation.

related_issues.title: LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser
related_issues.text: LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.4 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Copilot's LTM is unable to see the content of a sandbox (eg. [Svelte Tutorial](https://svelte.dev/tutorial/kit/handlefetch)). ## GitHub Issue Summary: Copilot Live Context Issues **Key points raised:** - User @dotnetemmanuel reported issues with Copilot Live Context not working on Linux. - Related issues were identified and shared with the user. - Pieces support confirmed the issue and informed the user of an upcoming stability release. **Problems identified:** - Copilot Live Context was not functioning on Linux. - The user was unable to access the full functionality of the feature. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** - A stability release for PiecesOS (v11.1.0 and 11.1.1) was scheduled for early February 2025. **Current status/outcome:** - The user was encouraged to update to the latest version of PiecesOS and test the functionality. - The issue outcome is pending further feedback from the user.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS launch issues:** Focus on addressing the root causes of installation failures, application crashes, and incompatibility with M1 Macs to ensure a smooth user experience.
**Improve communication around Pieces OS updates:** Provide clear instructions on how to install the correct build (Intel vs. Apple Silicon) to prevent boot failures after updates.
**Investigate and address Linux-specific issues:** Allocate resources to resolve issues related to Copilot Live Context, app freezes, and inability to open the Copilot service on Linux systems.
**Review and optimize localhost access documentation:** Clarify port configurations and troubleshooting steps for users experiencing difficulties accessing Pieces on localhost.
**Consider a dedicated support channel for Pieces OS:** Given the increasing number of OS-related issues, a dedicated support channel could streamline issue resolution and improve response times.
